title: Other than Oxbridge, what UK universities can be considered prestigious? - Quora

response.answer_text: The London Business School, University of London ( Postgraduate only ) The London School of Economics & Political Science, University of London Imperial College London University College London, University of London King's College London, University of London University of Bristol University of Manchester University of Edinburgh Royal College of Art, University of London Then the next tier down : Durham University University of Sheffield University of Nottingham University of Birmingham University of Warwick University of Leeds University of Glasgow Then after those : Newcastle University University of Liverpool St. Andrews Universities well known for specific subjects : University of Leicester ( Genetics ) University of Dundee ( Biochemistry, Dentistry ) School of Oriental & African Studies, University of London ( African & Asian languages, Politics, Anthropology, History, Development studies ) Royal Holloway College, University of London ( Music, Drama, History ) Queen Mary Westfield College, University of London ( History, English, Geography, Law ) University of Sussex ( Development studies ) University of East Anglia ( Environmental Studies, Creative Writing ) University of York ( English, Social Policy, Archaeology ) Loughborough University ( Sports Science ) University of Reading ( Agriculture ) University of Surrey ( Electrical Engineering ) City University London ( Actuarial Science ) University of Essex ( Sociology ) Lancaster University ( Linguistics ) Goldsmith's College, University of London ( Media Arts, Art & Design, Sociology ) Royal Veterinary College, University of London Heriot-Watt University ( Petroleum Engineering ) Best Music Conservatories, Fine Art, & Acting schools : Royal College of Art ( Postgraduate only ) University of the Arts London Goldsmiths College, University of London Glasgow College of Art Royal Academy of Dramatic Arts: ( RADA ) Royal College of Music Royal Academy of Music, University of London

The QS global ranking asks employers for their opinion of the reputation of universities. This is probably a better measure of prestige among the informed public than academic reputation rankings (as also used by QS and by Times Higher Education alongside other rankings) as academics are asked who is best o at doing research in their field, not whose graduates they look to employ. The 10 UK universities in the top 50 in the world as ranked by international employers are: OxfordCambridgeImperialLSEUCLManchesterWarwickEdinburghDurhamLondon Business SchoolTo put this in a US context, Cornell comes in 49th, just behind London Business School. All of these could be considered at the Ivy League level of prestigiousness internationally (taken as an average, Americans might well rate them lower but this is cancelled out by people elsewhere rating them higher). One university missing from that list which would certainly be considered prestigious in the UK is St Andrews, which comes in 162nd in the QS ranking. This is probably because it is a small university that isn't well known outside of the UK, despite being in the top three of all of the national rankings.
